intro: Canthium decaryi, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open woodlands. Canthium decaryi is adapted to thrive in dry and semi-arid conditions.
